etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Journal of the Chemical Society. From German Zeunerit from the name of Gustav Anton Zeuner, German physicist and engineer + German -it

definitions: A mineral consisting of a hydrated arsenate of uranium and copper, typically occurring as bright green prisms.

notes.text: Formula: Cu(UO₂)₂(AsO₄)₂·xH₂O. Crystal system: tetragonal. Two species are now distinguished: Weisbach's original mineral, in which x = 8, is called metazeunerite, with zeunerite denoting more hydrated forms (x = 10–16).
